meanings.def: nervous or embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people
examples: He is not exactly the shy and retiring type.
Don't be shy—come and say hello.
She was too shy to ask anyone for help.
As a teenager I was painfully shy.
shy around/with somebody She's very shy with adults.
a quiet, shy man
She was terribly shy around strangers.
She went all shy and hid behind her mother.
You don't have to be shy with me, you know.
She felt suddenly shy as the large crowd fell silent.

meanings.def: showing that somebody is nervous or embarrassed about meeting and speaking to other people
examples: a shy smile
a shy grin/glance
his shy demeanour/temperament

meanings.def: easily frightened and not willing to come near people
examples: The panda is a shy creature.

meanings.def: afraid of doing something or being involved in something
examples: shy of/about something The band has never been shy of publicity.
shy of/about doing something He disliked her and had never been shy about saying so.

meanings.def: not having quite the amount that is needed to be something or to reach a particular figure
examples: We are still two players shy (of a full team).
He died before Christmas, only a month shy of his 90th birthday.
The bill was just shy of $1 million.

meanings.def: avoiding or not liking the thing mentioned
examples: camera-shy (= not liking to be photographed)
He's always been work-shy.

meanings.def: to be unwilling to accept something or do something, and to try to avoid it
examples: Successive governments have fought shy of such measures.

meanings.def: after an unpleasant experience you are careful to avoid something similar

idioms.idiom: fight shy of something/of doing something
idioms.def: to be unwilling to accept something or do something, and to try to avoid it
examples: Successive governments have fought shy of such measures.

idioms.def: after an unpleasant experience you are careful to avoid something similar

related: fight shy of something/of doing something

meanings.def: to turn away with a sudden movement because it is afraid or surprised
examples: My horse shied at the unfamiliar noise.
Her horse shied violently at a gorse bush.
